intro: Hesperantha acuta, commonly known as the sharp-hesperantha, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperantha acuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
